intro: Mansoa truncata, commonly known as the truncated mansoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
